page.title: 04CASTLE BYTHAM PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: The school is behind St. James'church at the top of a steep lane.There are 43 children in the school at September 1985.There are two full time teachers and one part time teacher.Children start school at four + years and finish at 11+ .It has one large junior playground and one grassy orchard for the infants.The school is built of stone and is quite old.There are three classrooms.In the junior classroom there is a hole in the wall with a glass cover and inside it there are two coronation mugs and two medals.There is also a bill showing how much the local celebrations cost.This is very faded now.These things have been in the wall for 74 years for they are from King George's and Queen Mary's coronation. (1911)
